meanings.definition: A unit of pitch in a language, used to distinguish words or syllables
meanings.sent1: In the song, each toneme represented a different word.
meanings.sent2: The toneme at the end of the word changed its meaning.
meanings.sent3: The toneme seemed to dance along the musical notes.
meanings.sent4: Her voice rose and fell like a toneme in a symphony.
meanings.sent5: The toneme echoed through the room, filling it with sound.

meanings.definition: A distinctive pitch pattern in a language, used to convey meaning
meanings.sent1: The toneme in her speech made it easy to understand her emotions.
meanings.sent2: His toneme always indicated whether he was happy or sad.
meanings.sent3: The toneme in the conversation sounded like a melody.
meanings.sent4: The toneme of her voice cut through the noise of the crowd.
meanings.sent5: The toneme of the language added depth to the storytelling.
